hough_tools module¶

hough_tools.applyHough(np_img, radii, num_peaks)¶
Convenience function for loopApplyHough. Needs input raster loaded as numpy array and a list of radii made with np.arange().

Returns the weight, pixel location, and radius of each detected circle.

Parameters

  • input_raster (numpy array) – Numpy array of input raster

  • radii (list(int)) – a list of radii made with np.arange()

  • num_peaks (int) – maximum number of detections per search.

Returns

Coordinates of the circle detections and their weights

Return type

int, int, int, float.

hough_tools.chunkedRastersHough(input_dir, output_dir, params, target='.tif')¶

Applies Hough transforms to each image in a directory.

Parameters

  • input_dir (str) – Filepath to the directory with subdivided images.

  • output_dir (str) – Filepath to the directory where detections will be saved.

  • params (list[[int, int, int]]) – See params section for more informaiton.

  • target (str) – The file ending for valid inputs, defaults to ‘.tif’

hough_tools.houghAllDirsMP(input_root, temp_root, output_root, original_img_dir, num_workers, target='.tif', save_intermediate=False, overwrite=False)¶

Multiprocessing implementation of houghOnDir.

Parameters

  • input_root (str) – Filepath to the directory containing clustered subimages.

  • temp_root (str) – Filepath to the directory where intermediate outputs will be created.

  • pixel_dir (str) – The filepath to the directory where pixel detection outputs will be stored.

  • original_img_dir (str) – Filepath with the original images used to create subimages.

  • num_workers (int) – Number of workers to assign.

  • target (str) – The file ending for valid inputs, defaults to ‘.tif’

  • save_intermediate (bool) – Flag to save intermediate outputs to disk, defaults to False.

  • overwrite (bool) – Flag to overwrite existing outputs, defaults to False.

hough_tools.houghCircleQueue(q, input_root, temp_root, pixel_dir, original_img_dir, target='.tif', save_intermediate=False, overwrite=False)¶

This is a queue for multiprocessing.

Parameters

  • q (Multiprocessing.Queue object) – the queue generated by houghAllDrisMP

  • input_root (str) – Filepath to the directory containing clustered subimages.

  • temp_root (str) – Filepath to the directory where intermediate outputs will be created.

  • pixel_dir (str) – The filepath to the directory where pixel detection outputs will be stored.

  • original_img_dir (str) – Filepath with the original images used to create subimages.

  • num_workers (int) – Number of workers to assign.

  • target (str) – The file ending for valid inputs, defaults to ‘.tif’

  • save_intermediate (bool) – Flag to save intermediate outputs to disk, defaults to False.

  • overwrite (bool) – Flag to overwrite existing outputs, defaults to False.

hough_tools.houghOnDir(input_dir, temp_dir, output_csv, base_image, target='.tif', cleanup=True)¶

Applies Hough transforms to all images in a directory and merges the results.

Parameters

  • input_dir (str) – Filepath to the directory with subdivided images.

  • temp_dir (str) – The filepath to the directory where intermediate outputs will be stored.

  • output_csv (str) – Filepath to the desired output.

  • base_image – Filepath to the original image.

  • target (str) – The file ending for valid inputs, defaults to ‘.tif’

  • cleanup (bool) – Controls whether or not intermediate files are removed upon completion, defaults to True.

hough_tools.houghStep1(input_root, temp_root, pixel_dir, original_img_dir, num_workers, target='.tif', save_intermediate=False, overwrite=False)¶

Parallel Hough detections to pixel coordinates.

Parameters

  • input_root (str) – Filepath to the directory containing clustered subimages.

  • temp_root (str) – Filepath to the directory where intermediate outputs will be created.

  • pixel_dir (str) – The filepath to the directory where pixel detection outputs will be stored.

  • original_img_dir (str) – Filepath with the original images used to create subimages.

  • num_workers (int) – Number of workers to assign.

  • target (str) – The file ending for valid inputs, defaults to ‘.tif’

  • save_intermediate (bool) – Flag to save intermediate outputs to disk, defaults to False.

  • overwrite (bool) – Flag to overwrite existing outputs, defaults to False.

hough_tools.houghStep2(original_img_dir, pixel_dir, output_dir, num_workers, target='.tif')¶

Parallel pixel metrics.

Parameters

  • original_img_dir (str) – Filepath with the original images used to create subimages.

  • pixel_dir (str) – The filepath to the directory where pixel detection outputs will be stored.

  • num_workers (int) – Number of workers to assign.

  • target (str) – The file ending for valid inputs, defaults to ‘.tif’

hough_tools.houghStep3(input_dir, output_dir)¶

Apply CRS and transform to buffered .shp.

Parameters

  • input_dir (str) – Filepath to an input directory with .csv’s created by Hough tools

  • ouput_dir – Filepath to directory where output .shp’s will be saved.

hough_tools.loopApplyHough(np_img, output_csv, params)¶
Needs strings of filepaths to input raster and output csv, and a list

of parameters in the format [[min_rad, max_rad, num_peaks], …]. Searches an image for all sets of those parameters and saves them in the output .csv.

Parameters

  • np_img (numpy array) – Raster loaded as numpy array

  • output_csv (str) – Filepath to save the merged output .csv

  • params (list[[int, int, int]]) – See params section for more informaiton.

hough_tools.mergeChunkedDetections(plot, input_dir, x_len, y_len, output_csv, target='.csv')¶

This is being rewritten for the new clusters.

Parameters

  • plot (int) – plot ID for image, used to label detections.

  • input_dir (str) – Filepath to the directory with detections (temp dir from chunkedRastersHough)

  • x_len (int) – Width of the input image

  • y_len (int) – Length of the input image

  • output_csv (str) – Filepath to save the merged output .csv

  • target (str) – The file ending for valid inputs, defaults to ‘.csv’
